issue.title: [C++] Implement InputStream for bz2 files
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3381](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3381). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
For reading compressed CSV files

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3381?focusedCommentId=16633908) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Isn't it basically the same as `ARROW-1019` but with a different `Codec` instance?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3381?focusedCommentId=16633933) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yeah. As part of this we'd need to add bzip2 to our toolchain

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3381?focusedCommentId=16653331) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
There is no upstream maintenance of bzip2 anymore and its build chain is rusty, so I think we'll need to always rely on binaries (e.g. from Anaconda).
